main event: A witness reported seeing a glowing, yellowish object the size of a golf ball that seemed to hover and slowly rise, moving to the east and northeast.
interesting points: The object was seen over the top of the neighbor's roof while the witness was looking at the stars.
The object was observed climbing from 30 to 45 degrees above the horizon, to the east of the observer.
The object was observed for about 45 minutes.
There was normal air traffic in the Cleveland area at the time.
The report was provided to the preparing officer by a lieutenant at the Cleveland ARTC (Air Route Traffic Control) Center.
result: Inconclusive - Possible Satellite, Balloon, or Aircraft
sighted object: A glowing, yellowish object the size of a golf ball
